New Records: Jamal Musiala scored his third goal in a European Championship, illuminating the tournament
Key Match Events: Kai Havertz scored from the penalty spot after a handball was called, giving Germany the lead
Denmark had a goal ruled out due to a VAR decision, with Joachim Andersen being adjudged offside by a toenail's length
The match was stopped for nearly 30 minutes due to a storm, with the playing area becoming unsafe
Jamal Musiala scored the third goal for Germany, finishing superbly after a pass from Nico Schlotterbeck
Pre-Game Insights: Germany were expected to blow Denmark away early on, but ultimately had to thank a handball law that is 'offensive to the sport's spirit'
Denmark had been chastised back home for dull group stage performances, but they had evidently spied an opportunity and looked the better side
Post-Match Reflections: Denmark manager Kasper Hjulmand was furious with the calls that sent them home, saying 'This is not how football is supposed to be'
Germany coach Julian Nagelsmann's team will need to be better than this if they face Spain in the quarter-finals
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played in a biblical drenching, with the Südtribüne part of the stadium emptying out to escape the rain
Germany had called Kasper Schmeichel into action four times in the first 11 minutes, with saves from Havertz and Joshua Kimmich particularly eye-catching
Others: The handball law that facilitated Germany's opener has been criticized for being a 'ruinous example of overreach'
The VAR official Stuart Attwell and the'snickometer' deployed in the control room were instrumental in awarding the penalty
